answers.answer: I will also pray for this baby, what is her first name?  Its quite odd about the fluid, it was present 2 weeks before birth. Is this your sisters first baby, could her water have broken perhaps when she was in the shower or bath-tub?  I am un aware of any condition that would cause the amnionic fluid to dissapear.How low is the babys temp? is she urinating and drinking formula or breast milk?Please let me know,,,Blessings and Prayers to your whole family,,,,Cherie

Yes its her first.  The day after she was born her levels were high so they put he under the lights for 2 days.  She has been breastfeeding fine but today just seemed listless.  I have read allot that they dont know how but it can disappear.Her temp would not go above 96.  The dr tried for 3 hrs.  They were going to do a spinal tap next to see if she has an infection I guess.  She was only 6lbs 10oz when born which isnt really small but the mom isnt a small person.  She is about 5'11' and about 200 lbs.  Not overweight but not a thin person.  Because of the no amniotic fluid the babys birth weight was low.  She is breast feeding and babies can loose 10% of there birthweight the first week.  We are worried because she is so tiny.  We hope she is strong enough to fight.  Thanks for the prayers. Amy

Levels of what were up?  Bilirubin?  If it's bilirubin, that's the compound that causes jaundice and that's why she would be under lights, not because of the low amniotic fluid.Does this baby have a heart problem?  I'm just wondering whether there is impaired blood flow to the extremities for some reason ie heart not pumping effectively or a problem with the blood vessels themselves.  This can make a baby really tired too.  Congenital heart problems can be associated with low amniotic fluids.Did your sister suffer from chronic high blood pressure, preeclampsia, diabetes or lupus during her pregnancy.Are the baby's kidney's okay?

if this is any reliefe or not honestly 6lb 10 ounces is not that small , its quite an ok birth weight,,,I would be more concerned about the core temp than the weight.I am not sure,,,I know above is right lights are used for jaundice but perhaps they can also be used for warming...I thought they warmd adult with low body temps with gradually warming water to a higher and higer temp whil pt is in a shallow bath....wondering if a similar method could not be used for baby....I certainly know nothing of nic-icu,,,please keep us up dated,,,lots of love nad prayers,...c

We knew the lights were for jaundice and they were concerned about her kidneys.  They did the spinal tap last night and we are waiting on the cultures to come back.  I know with low amniotic fluid it can cause kidney damage.  I want to thank you guys for your kind words and prayers.  I will keep you posted.

I pretty much had a "dry birth" myself.  They did not do a C section on me.  I gave birth vaginally, but it was rather difficult but no complications.  Apparantly, I was leaking clear watery fluid for approx. 11 or more days before giving birth.  That was my first pregnancy so I didn't think anything of it.When I was 3 months along, I asked my doctor, "How will I know when I go into labor?" She told me I would go into labor pains and my fluid would break and I would see lots of water and have no doubts.I never went into labor pains at home.  The only way I knew I was in labor was because I told my mom about the 11 or so days of leaking clear fluid a little at a time.  She made me call my gyno. (which I didn't feel was necessary at the time because I remembered my gyno saying there would be labor pains, lots of water and there would be no doubt in my mind that I would be in labor and until that happens there would be no reason for me to go and see her).Anyway, after making that call to my gyno. she ordered me come in for check up and immediately sent me to the hospital to induce labor.  It just so happened that that date was pretty close to the date the doctor suspected delivery if not right on it.  I somewhat argued with the gyno. that I was not in labor yet, because I was not feeling labor pains, nor have I witnessed "ALOT" of fluid like she said I would.  But apparantly, I was in labor for 11 days already and didn't know it.

question: My sister had a baby this last weekend.  After several hours in labor, no dialation or baby moving down, and the dr trying to break her water twice they decided to do a csection.  Once they got in they found she had no amniotic fluid.  she had several ultrasounds during her pregnancy and one 2 weeks before she had her.  None of them showed low or no fluid.  The baby now had cold limbs and no matter what the dr's do they cannot get her body temp up.  I have never known anyone that has had this happen before and being the mother of two kids myself I am worried she will not make it.  They are going to do a spinal tap soon if her temp doesnt come up.  She had to be under the lights for 2 days because her levels were way high after delivery.  Anyone that can give me some help would be greatly appreciated.  This is her first baby and I am praying everything will be ok.
title: no amniotic fluid at delivery
